author: terencechain

author: nishant0
content: <@199561711278227457> How do I search for a particular peer id ? I need to know which client pair is used by a node with a particular peer id

author: parithosh
content:
You can search for it here: https://config.pectra-devnet-6.ethpandaops.io/api/v1/nodes/inventory
If its not available, let me know and ill kick a refresh to make sure the latest data is on there

author: nishant0
content:
Does pandaops run this ip and port ?
```
/ip4/57.129.49.241/tcp/15101
```

author: nishant0
content: I can't find it in the inventory above

author: parithosh
content: However, ip lookup says its attestant: https://whatismyipaddress.com/ip/57.129.49.241

author: parithosh
content: its tied to eth-val-d02-02.attestant.io , cc <@447681299742982144> in case you need something from him

author: nishant0
content: Ah ok, that is good news. We were still seeing invalid blobs come from that particular node so I was worried the bug was not fully resolved since you rolled out the latest version. In that case that makes sense since attestant is probably on an older version. As long as we don't see bad blobs from pandaops nodes its fine.

author: bez625
content: Yes we are running the previous version still. I'll update within the next few hours

author: bez625
content: We rolled out the prysm update an hour or so ago. It looks to have [proposed a block](https://dora.pectra-devnet-6.ethpandaops.io/slot/62526) fine and I can't see the 5 != 6 error we were seeing previously
